TopicTitle: Things that NASA never said at a press conference.

Articles.Content:
"We're glad the Lego Merchandising Program served as a useful cover-up for our true source of funding: NASA hoodies and backpacks."

Edited January 13 by Kimera Industries
Page de la New
"Apparently using Legos to build rockets was going a bit too far."
Ok people, we are out of ideas and need some suggestions.
We have gotten so good at smashing probes into asteroids that we have forgotten how to land on the Moon.
"Thanks to a recent study, we can safely conclude that the sound from the Chicxulub asteroid impact sounded like this: Psheeew crrshshhh KBMmmMMmm cpeeewgh-"
Pay our ransom or we will cut off all the satellite TV channels.
"Unfortunately, we are going to have to cancel all planned missions for the next few months as our employees are all busy with KSP2 after For Science! came out."

We are adding "Limited" to the end of our name, so from now on call us...

NASAL
"We have been forced to admit that we used the JWST for cool selfies before it was launched."
"Pakled are strong".
"We are going to clean up all the plastics in the ocean."
"You know those supercomputers we have? We've been using those for nothing but KSP2. Sorry."
We will be lifting our rockets to the edge of space using cheap Hydrogen Balloons, then launching from there, this will save us a ton of money and cut down on waste and pollution.
"Our simulation software will be switching over from KSP1 to KSP2 once the game leaves early access. Once again, all requests that we use Orbit instead have been denied."
I wish they would bring back Spacefood Sticks.
"Due to overwhelming demand, we have sent the ISS astronauts real freeze-dried ice cream. They did not seem to appreciate it as much, especially when the crumbs got stuck in all the instruments."

"The ISS has already been equipped with the espresso coffee machine.
Now we are sending there lavender and other syrups to finally let the crew have a normal coffee, the lavender raf."
Has anybody accidentally picked up a stick of Plutonium?

"Due to an unfortunate mishap with the launch vehicle, the Perseverance rover is now exploring the Australian outback instead of Mars. However, we will not attempt to rescue it because we realized we don't actually know anything about Australia."
"We are switching to making electric cars. I mean how hard can it be?"
"Making electric cars is very hard. We are reverting back to spaceflight."
"We call this engine NASAL Spray for its exhaust."
"If anything goes wrong after the launch then we will just call 911"
"We have decided that exploring space is pointless and so we are shutting down and letting everyone go."

"You're funny, you see? Did you really believe that a probe can last for five decades in space?
We had lost it on the Saturn fly-by. Everything, you were watching since then, were just cartoons."
